subcategory.name: Badges
subcategory.description: Badge, chip, and pill examples for Tailwind CSS, designed and built by the creators of the framework.
subcategory.introduction: Use these Tailwind CSS badge components to highlight important information, statuses, or counts in your application. These badges are designed and built by the Tailwind CSS team, and include a variety of different styles.

<script>
     window.addEventListener('load', () => window.setTimeout(() => {
        const makeLink = (asset) => {
            const link = document.createElement('link')

            Object.keys(asset).forEach((attribute) => {
                link.setAttribute(attribute, asset[attribute])
            })

            return link
        }

        const loadNext = (assets, count) => window.setTimeout(() => {
            if (count > assets.length) {
                count = assets.length

                if (count === 0) {
                    return
                }
            }

            const fragment = new DocumentFragment

            while (count > 0) {
                const link = makeLink(assets.shift())
                fragment.append(link)
                count--

                if (assets.length) {
                    link.onload = () => loadNext(assets, 1)
                    link.onerror = () => loadNext(assets, 1)
                }
            }

            document.head.append(fragment)
        })

        loadNext([], 3)
    }))
</script><style>body { -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; -moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale;  }</style><body><div class="flex items-center justify-center bg-white p-8">

<script>
     window.addEventListener('load', () => window.setTimeout(() => {
        const makeLink = (asset) => {
            const link = document.createElement('link')

            Object.keys(asset).forEach((attribute) => {
                link.setAttribute(attribute, asset[attribute])
            })

            return link
        }

        const loadNext = (assets, count) => window.setTimeout(() => {
            if (count > assets.length) {
                count = assets.length

                if (count === 0) {
                    return
                }
            }

            const fragment = new DocumentFragment

            while (count > 0) {
                const link = makeLink(assets.shift())
                fragment.append(link)
                count--

                if (assets.length) {
                    link.onload = () => loadNext(assets, 1)
                    link.onerror = () => loadNext(assets, 1)
                }
            }

            document.head.append(fragment)
        })

        loadNext([], 3)
    }))

<script>
     window.addEventListener('load', () => window.setTimeout(() => {
        const makeLink = (asset) => {
            const link = document.createElement('link')

            Object.keys(asset).forEach((attribute) => {
                link.setAttribute(attribute, asset[attribute])
            })

            return link
        }

        const loadNext = (assets, count) => window.setTimeout(() => {
            if (count > assets.length) {
                count = assets.length

                if (count === 0) {
                    return
                }
            }

            const fragment = new DocumentFragment

            while (count > 0) {
                const link = makeLink(assets.shift())
                fragment.append(link)
                count--

                if (assets.length) {
                    link.onload = () => loadNext(assets, 1)
                    link.onerror = () => loadNext(assets, 1)
                }
            }

            document.head.append(fragment)
        })

        loadNext([], 3)
    }))
</script><style>body { -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; -moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale;  }</style><body><div class="flex items-center justify-center bg-white p-8">
